speaker: Niles
text: Do you think Maris and I are meant to be together? _Frasier puzzles over this.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. The apartment is empty except for Daphne who puts a gift bag on Martin's chair and then sits at the table.  Martin enters from his room._

speaker: Martin
text: [_notices bag_] Oh, what's this?

speaker: Daphne
text: I got you a gift.

speaker: Martin
text: You did?  What's the occasion?

speaker: Daphne
text: No reason.

speaker: Martin
text: You can't just give somebody something for no reason.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I can.

speaker: Martin
text: No, you can't.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I can!

speaker: Martin
text: No, you can't!

speaker: Daphne
text: You're starting to take the fun out of this.

speaker: Martin
text: But there's no reason for this.

speaker: Daphne
text: Does there have to be a reason?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, would you just open it up?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Jeez!

speaker: Daphne
text: I knitted it myself.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, gee!

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I had a bit of trouble with the rogue collar.  I'm surprised you didn't hear me cursing from my bedroom.

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, Daphne, this is really nice. [_puts it on_] I wish I had something to give you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, we're back on that again!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, all right, all right, but at least let me pay you for it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Pay me for it?!  It's a gift!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, just a couple of bucks for the yarn. _Daphne exits to the kitchen as Frasier enters in his squash gear from the front door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, is Niles home?

speaker: Martin
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, I've been standing out front for twenty minutes, we're going to be late for our squash court! Nice cardigan.

speaker: Martin
text: Daphne surprised me with it!

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't seem very happy about it.

speaker: Martin
text: No, well, I'm not, I mean you just don't give somebody something for no reason, that's my rule.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  Spontaneous gift-giving is one of life's great pleasures.  Didn't you ever give Mom anything without a warning?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, you!  Where do you think I got the rule from?!

speaker: Frasier
text: There you are! Come on, Niles, let's shake a leg!  We're going to be late for our court time.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, just a minute. [_on phone:_] Of course I do, Maris. [_pause_] Well, I miss you more.  No, I do.  No, I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_on phone:_] More than Van Cleaf would miss Arpell. [_laughs_] No, I don't.  No, you have the prettier laugh.  No, you do. No, you do.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm gonna go walk into the ocean!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh no, I would love to meet you for lunch but you know what Dr. Deutsch said; no meetings outside our therapy sessions. Oh, now, Maris. [_the phone beeps_] Wait, hold on a second, another line. [_switches lines_] Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_speaking into his phone_] Get the hell off the phone!

speaker: Niles
text: [_still into phone_] How rude!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_still in phone_] Please, don't you realise it's also rude to be late for an appointment!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you are telling me about being late... _Niles and Frasier carry on their phone argument until Frasier hangs up and faces him._

speaker: Niles
text: How dare you hang up on me! [_switches lines_] Honey, do you mind if we continue this conversation later?  Oh, I'll be counting the minutes too. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I hope you're happy, we've now officially lost our court!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm sorry.  I would hope that my attempt to salvage my marriage would be more important to you than a squash game!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course it is.  I was just looking forward to playing.

speaker: Niles
text: I enjoy a morning game of squash more than anyone.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I do.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no... Niles, I would love to see you and Maris reconciling, if that's what you want.  I'm just afraid you might be going a bit too quickly.  Would you like some coffee?

speaker: Niles
text: Please.

speaker: Frasier
text: Need I remind you that only last month she served you divorce papers!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm well aware of that, but we're not rushing into anything. We only see each other at therapy.  That reminds me, yesterday at the cafe I asked you a question which you deftly avoided answering.  Do you think Maris and I are meant to be together?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, well, er, that's a tough question.  You know, perhaps the better question would be, do you think you and Maris are meant to be together?

speaker: Niles
text: Hmmm, I served you up a question, you clumsily bat it back to me.  We've hardly missed our squash game at all!  No, no, I'm really interested in your opinion.  Let's say you were God.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, please, I don't want to play God!

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs_] Oh, please... no, just play along.  Let's say you are the supreme ruler of heaven and earth.  What would you do?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_eyes Eddie:_] Well, for starters I'd issue a recall on some of my lesser species!

speaker: Niles
text: I still want an answer to that question. [_answers_] Hello? What is it, pumpkin? [_pause_] Now, now, dear, calm down.  I'm sure the banging you hear is just the pipes; if one of the servants had actually been walled in during the remodeling, he would have died weeks ago. [_pause_] Okay, if it will ease your mind at all, why don't you have Marta take role call? [_phone beeps_] Hold on a second. [_changes lines_] Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on his phone_] Get out! _Niles leaves the apartment whilst talking to Maris.  FADE OUT  Scene Three - Radio Station. Frasier is finishing his show, Roz is in her booth._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this is Dr. Frasier Crane saying goodbye and good mental health. [_signs off_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_enters_] Your brother called.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lord, he must really want an answer to that question.

speaker: Roz
text: No, he just wanted to tell you the wine club meeting was cancelled.  What question?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yesterday he asked me straight up if I thought he and Maris were meant for each other.

speaker: Roz
text: That's a loaded question.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, you're telling me.  In fact, I don't even know what my answer is.

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't you just play it safe and say yes?  In my experience, when someone asks that question, they're not looking for honesty, they're looking for reassurance. Tell him what he wants to hear.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Trust me, Frasier.  It's like if I asked you, "Do I look fat in these pants?"

speaker: Frasier
text: [_thinking - without innuendo_] Yeah, you're right.  I guess there's only one way to answer that question.

speaker: Roz
text: What?!  Do you think I look fat in these?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I don't.

speaker: Roz
text: I work out every day...

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: It's the pleats, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it, get a hold of yourself!  I was thinking about what you had said.  I'm going to tell Niles yes, I think he and Niles were meant to be together.

speaker: Roz
text: Who are you waving to?  Is that Elise Edmunds from Promotions?

speaker: Frasier
text: We have a little date tonight.

speaker: Roz
text: A date?  And you didn't tell me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's no big deal, I don't even think she's interested in me.

speaker: Elise
text: Hey, Frasier.  Hey, Roz. [_they greet her_] Sorry to interrupt, I just wanted to make sure, am I still seeing you tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you are.  But of course, I'll be seeing you as well.

speaker: Elise
text: [_laughs_] Bye, Frasier.

speaker: Roz
text: Whoa-ho-ho!  That woman is totally into you!

speaker: Frasier
text: You think so?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah. [_breathy voice, pushing her hair back_] See you later, bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that a good sign?

speaker: Roz
text: Hello?  She might as well cat-roped you with her pantyhose!

speaker: Frasier
text: It probably should be a very interesting night.  Though she is very attractive, slender...

speaker: Roz
text: [_stops laughing_] Gee, I wonder why your mind went there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, not this again!

speaker: Roz
text: Of course it would.  Standing next to me, I hate these pants!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please.

speaker: Roz
text: I look like the Liberty Bell!

speaker: Frasier
text: The Liberty Bell has a crack in it! **SO THE ANSWER IS "YES"** _Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment. Martin is sat in his chair when Daphne enters._

speaker: Daphne
text: Afternoon, Mr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: I've got the mail.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks, you want to just put it on that table there.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is this for me?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, do you know anybody else around here who uses Eucalyptus bubble bath?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, your son occasionally likes...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, never mind.

speaker: Daphne
text: ThiS is lovely.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm glad you like it, because I picked it all out myself.  You know, I got you your fancy soaps and your moisturisers and this rock thing that scrapes all the dead skin off the bottom of your feet. [_off her glance_] Well, if you're going to nap on the couch, wear slippers.

speaker: Daphne
text: Still, Mr. Crane, you really overdid it.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I didn't.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't know if I can accept this.

speaker: Martin
text: Why not?

speaker: Daphne
text: Because you've spent far too much.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, well, I'll take a couple of things back.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, wait. [_puts one back_] Have that one. [_gives him another_]

speaker: Martin
text: Daphne, will you please just take the damn basket?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what are you getting so cross about?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what?  You can give me a gift but I'm not allowed to give you one back?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, so that's the only reason you gave me this?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, that's the way it works.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, where I come from you don't just give someone a gift because you have to. [_hands over basket_] Here, take your silly basket.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, fine.  Well then, you can take your crappy little cardigan back too. [_takes it off and gives it her_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Fine!

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know why you gave it to me in the first place.

speaker: Daphne
text: Because I like you.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I like you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Then why can't you just accept my gift and be happy?

speaker: Martin
text: I am happy, I love that cardigan.

speaker: Daphne
text: And I love my damn basket.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is all this?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, we're just exchanging our damn gifts.

speaker: Martin
text: Here. [_gives her basket_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Here. [_gives him cardigan_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_angry, yelling_] Thanks!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_angry, yelling_] Thank you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord, it's like Christmas morning in the Gambino household!

speaker: Martin
text: By the way, Niles called while you were in the shower to remind you about the squash tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's strange.  I just made that date this morning, he must be really champing at the bit to get an answer to that question.

speaker: Martin
text: What question?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, he asked me if I thought he and Maris were meant to be together.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if you ask me, you should keep your bazoo shut! You're always getting into trouble opening that big bazoo of yours!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh wonderful, dad, we've found a new word to strike from your vocabulary.  Along with patootie and bupkis!

speaker: Martin
text: You're going to answer him, aren't ya?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think I have to.  But listen, I'm just going to play it safe.  Tell him yes.  He's gonna do what he wants to anyway.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I don't know, he takes your opinion pretty damn seriously.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, when we were younger, there was a certain sway I had over him.  Oh God, do you remember that time back in prep school when he was going to try out for the track team and I convinced him all the really cool kids were going to join the Madrigal society.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm not just talking about school, I mean he's always come to you for career decisions, too - where to do his residency, where to set up his practice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm, perhaps I have underestimated my influence.  You know, frankly, my opinion could be the single most important factor in his making this decision.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't know if I'd go as far as that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please, dad.  You don't know what it's like to have your opinion matter!  Niles depends on me, he deserves my true and honest answer.

speaker: Martin
text: And what is that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Maris has always been spoilt and selfish and led him around by the nose, I'd have to say my answer would be no. Thank you, dad.  I've changed my answer from a yes to a no.

speaker: Martin
text: There you go. _Frasier sits in his leather chair and looks out the window.  Martin stands up._

speaker: Frasier
text: On the other hand... I knew it.  You know, there are a lot of other factors here, dad.  Niles does love Maris.

speaker: Frasier
text: She has agreed to go into therapy; Niles swears that she's a changed person.  I don't know, I guess if I really want to know what's going on in Maris's mind, I've got to ask her myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: You agree with that, don't you dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, sure. [_sits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I've got a couple of hours before my date.  So what I'm going to do, if I really want to know was Maris is thinking, I will go directly to the source. _FADE TO:  Scene Five - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier is sat at the table as the waitress approaches. _ Waitress: Are you ready to order?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, well, not quite yet, I'm still waiting on someone. [_stands_] Oh, there she is now. _Fraiser waves to someone entering.  We see a small, thin, pale woman wearing huge dark glasses with her head wrapped in a scarf enter the caf e, waving in his direction.   Could this be...?!  However, in the next split second, she turns to the person she was really waving at, and is immediately followed by Marta, Maris's 78 year-old Guatemalan maid, who returns Frasier's wave. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Marta! _Marta sits with Frasier.  End of Act One  Act Two  Scene One - Caf e Nervosa. Continuing from act one.  Marta and Frasier are chatting. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Marta, I can't tell you how nice it is to see you again.

speaker: Marta
text: My pleasure, and this coffee is too, too divine!

speaker: Frasier
text: I see your English lessons with Maris are progressing, yes?

speaker: Marta
text: Yes, she teaching me many words. [_points to a woman_] That coat is so _declass e._

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen Marta, I'm going to come right to my point.  Dr. Crane and Maris - Missy Crane - have both been seeing a couples' therapist lately and I understand it's going very well.

speaker: Marta
text: Therapy helping Missy Crane a lot.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  So you would say that she is a changed person?

speaker: Marta
text: _Si, si_ , Missy Crane very different: nicer to everyone, and this time no happy pills!  For my birthday she give me beautiful Chanel makeup bag.  It's a knock-off, but it's big!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right then, this is my question: if Dr. Crane and Mrs. Crane were to get back together, do you... do you think Mrs. Crane would treat Dr. Crane better?

speaker: Marta
text: Oh, _jess_ , please ask Dr. Crane to come home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Marta, you've been most helpful.  You know, lately I've been wondering if Niles and Maris ought to be together.  Now, thanks to you, I know that the answer to that question is yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Did I say something funny?

speaker: Marta
text: No, my beeper's on vibrate, it tickled me. [_takes it out_] Sorry, I have to go, Missy Crane needs me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's all right, I understand.

speaker: Marta
text: Thanks for coffee. [_blows him two kisses_] Call me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there is a limit!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enters_] Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Was that Mrs. Crane's Marta who was just leaving?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes it was, we were just sharing a coffee.  You know, I wanted to help allay some of my fears about Niles and Maris getting back together.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I expect she'll be glad to see Dr. Crane back in that household.  Well, I should get my beans.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, wait, Daphne, what do you mean?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm sure Dr. Crane acts as a good buffer between Mrs. Crane and the help.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gee, it never occurred to me that Marta might have an ulterior motive.

speaker: Daphne
text: Who can blame her?  Mrs. Crane can be a bit demanding. _Daphne goes to the back of the caf e where she meets a friend and chats with her before going to the counter.  Whilst she is doing all this, Frasier sits on his seat talking to himself, thinking Daphne is still there. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this taints Marta's entire testimony.  Is it possible she could have lied to me?  Now then, with my training there aren't many things that can escape my notice, as I'm sure you've observed, Daphne.  Gee, how could she lie to me?  Now you see the predicament I am in.  Every time somebody gives me a valid argument, somebody else comes along and gives me a perfectly valid counter-argument.  One minute I think the answer is yes, the next minute I think it's no!  God, this is driving me crazy.  Well, I've got to stick with it, Niles asked me what I think... that's it... what I think!  Of course I don't know what I think right now, well.  But it's hard to be focused...

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you agree, Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes, absolutely! **SO THE ANSWER IS~~"YES"~~ ,  ~~"NO"~~ ,  ~~"YES"~~ ,  "NO"?** _Scene Two - Streets Of Seattle. Frasier and his date, Elise, are getting into Frasier's car._

speaker: Elise
text: I'm so glad we're finally doing this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmmm? [_distant_] Me too.

speaker: Elise
text: Is everything all right, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, yes, I'm just a little preoccupied.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to himself_] Stop obsessing!  Enjoy the date!

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are.

speaker: Elise
text: So, where are we going?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I've chosen a little Italian place I know, if that's all right?

speaker: Elise
text: I trust your judgment, but then who doesn't?

speaker: Elise
text: Are you okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  Well, I told myself I wasn't going to bring this up to you, and I don't really think it's appropriate for a first date, but I haven't been able to think about anything else all day, so here goes: Do you think it's possible for two people to be meant for each other?

speaker: Elise
text: [_thinking he's talking about her and him_] You've thought about that all day?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_missing the signals_] Yes.

speaker: Elise
text: [_excited_] Why, yes I do!

speaker: Frasier
text: You do.  But how do you know that they're meant for each other?  Of course it's essential they have similar interests, goals in common...

speaker: Elise
text: Don't forget physical attraction.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, that's a given.  But you know, my ex-wife had all those things, our marriage was an unmitigated disaster.

speaker: Elise
text: She probably just didn't appreciate you.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not entirely.

speaker: Elise
text: Did she listen to your show everyday, sometimes even tape them so she could listen to it in bed at night?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_still missing signals_] I didn't have a show then.  I just- what it comes down to is, what is that special something that makes us cry out, "Yes, you're meant to be together!"

speaker: Elise
text: Who knows, all that matters is that we both feel it! [_a look of horrified realisation flashes across Frasier's face_] I should have told you months ago how I felt, but I was too insecure.  I never dreamed you felt the same way I did. [_Frasier turns away_] Frasier, don't turn shy on me now. What'cha thinking?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looks at her and laughs_] Elise, I'm thinking you are quite the practical joker! [_laughs_] Pretending not to know that I was really talking about my brother, Niles, and his wife. Surely Roz must have told you?

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, yes. [_fakes an embarrassed laugh_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Sense of humour, that's another thing for two to have in common.

speaker: Elise
text: Frasier, I have a headache, I think I'm gonna just take a rain-check on tonight, okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizing_] Elise, we can still go out, just pretend that none of this ever happened!

speaker: Elise
text: Perfect! _Elise gets out of the car and runs in embarrassment.  Mentally, Frasier kicks himself.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is lying on the couch nursing a cognac._

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't for the life of me figure out why this decision is causing me so much anxiety.  There's just so many things to be considered, you know.

speaker: Frasier
text: On the one hand, you know, perhaps I'm afraid if Niles and Maris reconcile, well then we may lose the friendship he and I developed during their separation.  On the other hand, if Maris does take him back, well then I won't have to feel so responsible for him.  There's just so much at stake!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, not that kind of steak!  Listen, you're driving me crazy, I can't hear myself think here, I'm going to take a walk.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, not with you.  Go away. [_then:_] Time for your bath!

speaker: Frasier
text: So gullible! _Frasier exits.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Streets Of Seattle. Frasier is walking the streets, looking miserable and confused. We hear Jazz music as he walks though the alleys, likening the scene to a black-and-white film noir.  Frasier notices a poster advertising a symphony which includes a piece, among others, by Charles Ives entitled "The Unanswered Question."  Frasier is wracked by this.  He carries on walking and passes a wall which is covered with petitions for the passing of Proposition Eleven.  There are some which say "Yes" and some which state "No."  Frasier notices this and is shocked by how it relates to his problem.  Frasier then comes to the end of the sidewalk and looks up at the crossing sign.  It seems to be on the blink and keeps flashing between "Walk" and "Don't Walk" without giving time to think. Frasier steps forward, stops, steps forward, stops and continues this perpetual cycle.  He then passes a cinema.  According to the sign it says it is time for a "Jack Benny Festival" and "To Be Or Not To Be" is playing._ [_N.B. Jack Benny is Kelsey Grammer's strongest comedic inspiration._] _Frasier looks down at his feet and kicks a can along the streets whilst hearing tidbits of advice that were heard earlier in the episode:_

speaker: Roz
text: [_v.o_] Tell him what he wants to hear.

speaker: Martin
text: [_v.o_] He takes your opinion pretty damn seriously!

speaker: Marta
text: [_v.o_] Missy Crane very different, nicer to everyone.

speaker: Martin
text: [_v.o_] Bazoo!  Bazoo!  Shut your bazoo!

speaker: Roz
text: [_v.o_] Fat!  Fat!  Fat!  Fat! Eddie: [_v.o: barks_] _Frasier tries to make sense of it all.  Scene Five - Niles's Apartment. The apartment is in darkness as the doorbell rings.  Niles runs down the stairs in his dressing gown, turns on the lights and slowly goes to the door.  He picks up a small ornament of a violin and holds it above his head as protection._

speaker: Niles
text: Who's there?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s_] It's Frasier, let me in.

speaker: Niles
text: How did you get up here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the doorman was asleep.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what a coincidence, so was I.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Niles, I apologise for the late hour.

speaker: Niles
text: What's wrong?  You smell of the streets!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I was wandering Seattle in desperate search for an answer to your question.  I know how crucial my opinion is to you and I didn't want to take your question lightly.

speaker: Niles
text: ...What question?

speaker: Frasier
text: You asked me if I thought you and Maris were meant for each other.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, right.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't believe it!  I've been to hell and back agonizing over this question and you forgot!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, I didn't forget.  I'm sorry, Frasier, I'm groggy. Come in, come in.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm touched that you've given this so much thought. You're a good brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: So, please.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this is hard for me to say but... no.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't think you and Maris are meant to be together. I believe that a marriage should be built on a foundation of friendship and mutual respect.  With Maris I fear that you never experienced those things fully.  And I question whether you'll ever be truly happy.

speaker: Niles
text: [_takes it in_] I see.  Well, thank you. [_stands_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stands_] You're hurt, aren't you?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I-I just need some time to process this.  I appreciate you stopping by, it's just that it's one of those times I need to be alone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did you just hear a bell?

speaker: Niles
text: No.  Glad you came, go home, get some rest...

speaker: Frasier
text: There it is again.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I don't think so.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait a minute... Oh, Niles!  Maris is here, isn't she? How could you?!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, she offered and I said yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: How could you do something like this without waiting for my opinion?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, someone certainly has a high opinion of his opinion!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, why don't you just go run back to her before she sprains her wrist!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Frasier, I know what you're thinking, but you're wrong.  Maris has changed.  She now understands that she cannot control me.  I am my own man.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't actually respond to that. [_The bell rings_] It's a little joke we have between us. [_A whistle is blown_] Okay, that means business! _Niles closes the door on Frasier and bounds up the stairs. Outside, Frasier leaves in disgust.  End of Act Two_
